other_tests.findings: GH-E32A produced significantly increased amounts of 17.5-kDa GH isoform (55% of total GH protein) compared with wt-GH.
Low peak levels of GH during sleep (3.2 ng/ml) and arginine stimulation test (2.4 ng/ml); other hormones were normal.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At retesting off GH at age 16.6 yr peak GH levels to arginine and exercise were 5.8 and 2 ng/ml, respectively.

other_tests.findings: Normal peak GH level of 12.3 ng/ml.
other_tests.changes_over_time: IGF-I level at age 25 yr was low at 101 ng/ml (normal range 127â€“360 ng/ml; /H110023.1 SDS).

other_tests.findings: Cell proliferation rates of cells expressing GH-E32A or coexpressing wt-GH and GH-E32A were significantly lower than those expressing wt-GH.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Lower cell proliferation rates were observed at day 3.

other_tests.findings: Significantly lower colocalization of GH-E32A with secretory granules compared with wt-GH.
